name: Avoid large Programs - too many Lines of Code (ABAP)
description: ABAP programs should have a reasonable size. This reports shows all the ABAP programs with more than 500 lines of code. 500 being a parameter.
output:
Associated to each ABAP Program with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The number of LoC
rationale: Large programs are more difficult to understand, and are a sign of a bad modularity of the code.
remediation: Review the design of the program to reduce its size.
alternativeName: Avoid large Programs - too many Lines of Code (ABAP)

technicalCriteria.name: CWE-1080: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
